newsitem.title: USA: HARTFORD LIFE ASSUMES $100 MLN IN POLICIES.
newsitem.headline: HARTFORD LIFE ASSUMES $100 MLN IN POLICIES.

text.p: Hartford Life and Accident Insurance Co said Friday it will assume a block of predominantly group life and disability insurance business from Confederation Life Insurance Co U.S. in Rehabilitation.

Hartford Life, a group disability insurance company and member of The Hartford Financial Services Group Inc, said in a statement it will assume more than $100 million in policy reserves, affecting about 6,000 policyholders, claimants and beneficiaries.
Hartford Life has been involved in the assumption of more than $5 billion worth of insurance business over the past five years, representing more than 250,000 policyholders, it said.
